intro: Myrsine porteriana, commonly known as the mountain myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Myrsine porteriana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
